title: The unwritten rules of skiing and riding on a mountain, according to readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Readers emphasize the importance of following personal space and safety etiquette on chairlifts and gondolas at ski resorts.
Skiers are advised to avoid stopping in the middle of slopes and to maintain safe distances from others.
Etiquette inside lodges includes using ski racks properly and not occupying tables all day with personal items.

title: Jayson Tatum still has ‘a ways to go’ to return as Brad Stevens says Celtics’ star didn’t have impact on deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum's return from an Achilles tear isn't imminent, says Celtics' president Brad Stevens.
The Celtics traded Anfernee Simons for Nikola Vucevic, unrelated to Tatum's potential return.
Vucevic's acquisition aims to bolster Celtics' frontcourt despite Tatum's uncertain comeback this season.

title: Back in California, Patriots safety duo’s journey to Super Bowl LX has come full circle
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots safeties Craig Woodson and Jaylinn Hawkins reunite in California for Super Bowl LX, both hailing from Cal.
Woodson and Hawkins became unexpected starters for New England, contributing to a strong defense this season.
Both players have excelled in postseason play, helping the Patriots' defense limit opponents to 8.7 points per game.

title: A Mass. man was found dead in a trash can in S.C. Here’s what we know.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: David Hutchinson, a Massachusetts man, was found dead in a trash can in Marion, South Carolina, in late January 2026.
Police suspect homicide and arrested 41-year-old Jaida Braddy for allegedly helping dispose of Hutchinson's body.
Hutchinson was last heard from early January; his family alleges his trip to South Carolina was under false pretenses.

title: Puppy Bowl XXII: Meet Team Ruff’s and Team Fluff’s representatives from New England rescues
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Thirteen New England rescue dogs will participate in Puppy Bowl XXII, representing shelters from Massachusetts, Maine, and Connecticut.
Lobster Roll, a bulldog and border collie mix from Westbrook, Maine, is highlighted for her participation on Team Ruff.
All 13 participating dogs have found homes, but their original shelters still have other dogs available for adoption.

title: Look inside this newly renovated Lake Winnipesaukee resort
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mill Falls Resort Collection in Meredith, NH, completed renovations on Chase House and Palmer Inn for the 2026 season.
Renovations brought coastal modern style to guest rooms with features like fireplaces, walk-in showers, and balconies.
Resort amenities include six restaurants, pools, a spa, an activity center, and year-round outdoor activities.

title: Boston to spend $135 million in taxpayer dollars for White Stadium overhaul, Wu says
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston plans to spend $135 million of taxpayer funds to renovate White Stadium, with completion set by late 2025.
Boston Legacy FC to contribute $190 million to the renovation, aiming to turn the site into a professional soccer venue.
Community concerns include traffic impacts, with a lawsuit challenging the project now before Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court.

title: Where will ‘underdog’ Patriots fans watch the Super Bowl in Seattle?
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Seattle's Patriots fans lacked a venue for Super Bowl watch parties, initially struggled to find space for 80 fans.
Shawn O'Donnell's Irish pub will host the Patriots fans, offering Sam Adams beers and Patriots-themed cocktails.
Boston Sports Fan Group of Seattle reached a venue agreement at the last minute after issues with other locations.

title: Waymo wants to expand into Boston. Massachusetts law isn’t ready.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Waymo seeks to expand its autonomous vehicle operations to Boston, pending Massachusetts' legislative authorization.
State Rep. Dan Cahill filed legislation to establish a regulatory framework for autonomous vehicles in Massachusetts.
Some Boston officials express concerns over Waymo's ability to navigate the city's complex streets effectively.

title: Why Justin Herbert MVP voter picked Chargers QB over Drake Maye, Matthew Stafford
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Justin Herbert received one first-place MVP vote, impacting Drake Maye's chances to win over Matthew Stafford.
Voter Sam Monson chose Herbert citing his value to the Chargers despite poor team performance and surrounding talent.
Drake Maye had better personal statistics and team performance compared to Herbert for the season.
